source_zh: 一开始，你不知道这只是一个错误的音符，是某个掉落下来、在最终静止之前的短暂翻滚时发出的声音，还是一个真正的错误，一个刺耳的干扰，一场真正危机的前兆。

The model also uses "real crisis to come" when the original says "a real crisis," which is more immediate. The correct translation should be "One never knows, at first, whether it is just a false note, the sound of things falling and continuing to roll briefly before finally coming to a stop, or a real clunker, a more jarring interruption, the herald of a real crisis."

source_zh: 随着对德隆寺的控制卷入了敌对的法律诉讼中，驻扎于新德里的噶玛巴无疑会认为最近缴获的现金彻底“揭露”了他那由中国选定的对手。

source_zh: 没有任何一个数学家能记得如此史无前例且令人叹为观止的结果：随着自主变成相互依赖（至少是在拯救中的短暂一刻 ） ， 平行线相交了。

source_zh: 在股权受控的公司，投资者担心的问题是小投资者的分散，而让董事更加响应控股股东的要求，可能使小投资者的利益更加容易受到损害。

Analysis: The model translation is "In a shareholder-controlled company, investors worry about the fragmentation of small shareholders, while allowing directors to be more responsive to the demands of the controlling shareholder may make it easier to trample on the interests of small investors." The correct translation should be "In controlled firms, where the concern is diversion from minority shareholders, making directors even more responsive to the controller will likely make minority investors still more vulnerable."

source_zh: 但再假设这位经济学家继续指出，因此，给病人使用盘尼西林是愚蠢的，因为我们知道98%的可治疗疾病是通过传统药物治愈的，而盘尼西林不属于传统药物。

source_zh: 接下来我会听到令人神往的故事，比如在自家门廊上观赏壮观的海上落日、山坡上大片大片五颜六色的野花，以及幽静美丽的环境中快乐的家庭团聚（此外还有各式各样的管道问题 ） 。

source_zh: 因此，新的发表内容和动态网页，由于它们的内容经常改变且已超出流行的使用方法的范围，搜索这种资料很容易受到基本操作技术的误导。

source_zh: 七十年前，日本被夷为平地，每个月，美国公民都会给我们的孩子们寄送或带来儿童牛奶、温暖的毛衣甚至山羊等礼物。

predicted_en: Before that happens, it would be good for the world if the US continued to run an unprecedented current-account deficit at the rate of $50 billion a year.
Analysis: The model translation is "Before that happens, it would be good for the world if the US continued to run an unprecedented current-account deficit at the rate of $50 billion a year." The model changes "$500 billion" to "$50 billion," which is a tenfold error that dramatically understates the scale of the deficit being discussed. The phrase "it is in the rest of the world's interest" is changed to "it would be good for the world," which softens the stronger claim about where interests lie. The model also omits the phrase "by financing it," which explains how the world enables this deficit. The correct translation should be "Until this happens, it is in the rest of the world's interest to let the US continue to run an unprecedented current account deficit by financing it at the rate of $500 billion per year."

source_zh: 虽然许多吸烟者很晚才发现该行业如此劣行，但在法律诉讼中发现的档案表明该行业一直协同发力攻击公共卫生科学及科学家，以规避政府监管。
target_en: Though discovery of these efforts has come too late for many tobacco smokers, documents unearthed in lawsuits have revealed concerted efforts to avoid the imposition of government regulation by attacking public health science and scientists.
predicted_en: While many smokers were late to the party, documents uncovered in legal cases show that the industry coordinated its attacks on public-health science and scientists to evade government regulation.
Analysis: The model translation is "While many smokers were late to the party, documents uncovered in legal cases show that the industry coordinated its attacks on public-health science and scientists to evade government regulation." The phrase "late to the party" is an informal idiom that is inappropriate for this serious topic about tobacco industry deception and is not present in the source. The phrase "discovery of these efforts has come too late" is about the timing of uncovering tobacco industry tactics, not about smokers being late to anything. This creates a confusing and flippant tone that misrepresents the gravity of tobacco companies deceiving smokers. The correct translation should be "Though discovery of these efforts has come too late for many tobacco smokers, documents unearthed in lawsuits have revealed concerted efforts to avoid the imposition of government regulation by attacking public health science and scientists."

source_zh: 第三，与西方的普遍看法不同，王岐山 — — 中国最精明、最有经验的高级官员之一 — — 在政治局常委中担任纪委书记一职并非沦为陪衬。
target_en: Third, and contrary to prevailing wisdom in the West, Wang Qishan, one of China’s savviest and most experienced senior officials, has not been relegated to obscurity in his new position overseeing “discipline” on the Standing Committee.
predicted_en: Third, in contrast to the prevailing view in the West, Wang Qishan, one of China’s most astute and experienced senior officials, has not been sidelined in his role as head of the Communist Party’s disciplinary commission on the Politburo Standing Committee (PSC).
Analysis: The model translation is "Third, in contrast to the prevailing view in the West, Wang Qishan, one of China's most astute and experienced senior officials, has not been sidelined in his role as head of the Communist Party's disciplinary commission on the Politburo Standing Committee (PSC)." The phrase "relegated to obscurity" is changed to "sidelined," which weakens the meaning since being relegated to obscurity is stronger than just being sidelined. The model adds excessive detail about the "Communist Party's disciplinary commission" and the acronym "PSC" that are not in the source, making the sentence more bureaucratic. The word "discipline" in the reference is simpler and the model's expansion is unnecessary. The correct translation should be "Third, and contrary to prevailing wisdom in the West, Wang Qishan, one of China's savviest and most experienced senior officials, has not been relegated to obscurity in his new position overseeing 'discipline' on the Standing Committee."

source_zh: 但眼睁睁看着这么多鱼类在自己手中令人震惊地陷于崩溃，让曾经丰饶的海洋环境和众多渔民的生活生计在自己面前受到削弱和破坏的管理机构同样可能无法摆脱厄运。
target_en: But so, too, could be the organizations that have presided over a breathtaking collapse of so many fisheries and left a once-bountiful marine environment – and the lives and livelihoods of many fishermen – damaged and degraded in their wake.
predicted_en: But the management agencies that have watched in horror as so many fisheries have collapsed and degraded the marine environment and the livelihoods of countless fishermen are no more immune to disaster than the fish in their care.
Analysis: The model translation is "But the management agencies that have watched in horror as so many fisheries have collapsed and degraded the marine environment and the livelihoods of countless fishermen are no more immune to disaster than the fish in their care." The model creates an awkward phrase "watched in horror" that is not in the source and adds melodrama. The phrase "breathtaking collapse" is omitted, losing the emphasis on the scale of the failure. The expression "no more immune to disaster than the fish" is confusing and illogical since fish are not immune to disaster at all, making this an ineffective comparison. The correct translation should be "But so, too, could be the organizations that have presided over a breathtaking collapse of so many fisheries and left a once-bountiful marine environment – and the lives and livelihoods of many fishermen – damaged and degraded in their wake."

source_zh: 关于推进多元文化的一场举国讨论正在进行中，并且使公众对建国五项原则又重燃兴趣，这一民族哲学思想在苏哈托统治时期被受到质疑，而现在它被一些人看作是印尼历史上多元文化的一种象征。
target_en: A national dialogue about fostering pluralism is now in progress, and has inspired renewed public interest in Pancasila, the national philosophy discredited during the Suharto years but now seen by some as a symbol of Indonesia’s historic pluralism.
predicted_en: A nation-building philosophy that was questioned during Suharto’s rule is now seen by some as a symbol of Indonesia’s multicultural past.
Analysis: The model translation is "A nation-building philosophy that was questioned during Suharto's rule is now seen by some as a symbol of Indonesia's multicultural past." The model completely omits the first part of the sentence about "a national dialogue about fostering pluralism is now in progress," which provides crucial context. The term "Pancasila" is omitted, removing the specific name of the philosophy being discussed. The model also omits "and has inspired renewed public interest," which connects the dialogue to the renewed interest in this philosophy. The phrase "historic pluralism" is changed to "multicultural past," which shifts the emphasis. The correct translation should be "A national dialogue about fostering pluralism is now in progress, and has inspired renewed public interest in Pancasila, the national philosophy discredited during the Suharto years but now seen by some as a symbol of Indonesia's historic pluralism."

source_zh: 即便如此，沙特仍竭尽全力吸引穆斯林、尤其是富有穆斯林前来朝圣，他们兴建大型购物中心和伦敦大本钟等旅游景点，后者与克尔白圣寺近在咫尺显得十分不协调。
target_en: Even so, it maintains strenuous efforts to attract pilgrims – particularly wealthy ones – by building attractions, including vast shopping malls and a colossal copy of London’s Big Ben that now looms incongruously over the Ka‘ba.
predicted_en: Nonetheless, the Saudis have done their best to attract Muslims, especially the wealthy, on pilgrimages, building large shopping malls and tourist attractions like the London Big Ben clock, which sits uncomfortably close to the Kaaba.
Analysis: The model translation is "Nonetheless, the Saudis have done their best to attract Muslims, especially the wealthy, on pilgrimages, building large shopping malls and tourist attractions like the London Big Ben clock, which sits uncomfortably close to the Kaaba." The phrase "maintains strenuous efforts" is changed to "have done their best," which sounds less formal and weakens the ongoing nature of these efforts. The word "pilgrims" is changed to "Muslims on pilgrimages," which is wordier. The phrase "colossal copy of London's Big Ben" is simplified to "London Big Ben clock," losing the emphasis on it being a copy and its massive size. The phrase "looms incongruously" is better than "sits uncomfortably close" at conveying the visual dominance and inappropriateness. The correct translation should be "Even so, it maintains strenuous efforts to attract pilgrims – particularly wealthy ones – by building attractions, including vast shopping malls and a colossal copy of London's Big Ben that now looms incongruously over the Ka'ba."

source_zh: 萨达姆被推翻后，另两个小布什总统所谓的邪恶轴心的成员 — — 伊朗和朝鲜认定，没有核武器使它们成为美国政变刀俎上的鱼肉。
target_en: And when he was brought down, the other two members of US President George W. Bush’s so-called axis of evil, Iran and North Korea, concluded that not having nuclear arms made them vulnerable to American attempts at regime change.
predicted_en: After Saddam’s overthrow, the other two members of the so-called Axis of Evil – Iran and North Korea – concluded that they were sitting ducks for an American coup d’état without nuclear weapons.
Analysis: The model translation is "After Saddam's overthrow, the other two members of the so-called Axis of Evil – Iran and North Korea – concluded that they were sitting ducks for an American coup d'état without nuclear weapons." The phrase "when he was brought down" is changed to "After Saddam's overthrow," which loses the more personal, action-oriented phrasing. The idiom "sitting ducks" is too informal and colloquial for this serious geopolitical context. The phrase "coup d'état" is overly formal and not quite accurate since the reference talks about "regime change," which is a broader concept than a coup. The model also loses the sense that nuclear weapons make them "vulnerable," replacing it with the more colorful but less precise "sitting ducks." The correct translation should be "And when he was brought down, the other two members of US President George W. Bush's so-called axis of evil, Iran and North Korea, concluded that not having nuclear arms made them vulnerable to American attempts at regime change."

source_zh: 因为中华文明深深地根植在2300万不同政治信仰的台湾人的日常生活当中，即便是政府的命令也难以轻易抹去。
target_en: The Chinese culture embodied in the daily lives of 23 million Taiwanese of whatever political beliefs was not so easily eliminated by decree.
predicted_en: Because Chinese civilization is so deeply rooted in the daily lives of Taiwan’s 23 million people of different political beliefs, even the government’s orders are difficult to erase.
Analysis: The model translation is "Because Chinese civilization is so deeply rooted in the daily lives of Taiwan's 23 million people of different political beliefs, even the government's orders are difficult to erase." The sentence structure "Because... even the government's orders are difficult to erase" is grammatically awkward, mixing a causal clause with a statement that does not logically follow as a consequence. The phrase "embodied in" from the reference is clearer than "rooted in" for describing how culture manifests in daily life. The phrase "not so easily eliminated by decree" is more natural than "difficult to erase," and "decree" specifically refers to government orders, making "even the government's orders" redundant. The correct translation should be "The Chinese culture embodied in the daily lives of 23 million Taiwanese of whatever political beliefs was not so easily eliminated by decree."

source_zh: 对它们来说，幸运之处在于，存在一种迫不得已的办法可以结合法国的根本顾虑（不平等性的危险）和德国的根本顾虑（过高的公债 ） 。
target_en: Fortunately for them, there is a compelling way to combine the fundamentally French concern about the dangers of inequality with the fundamentally German concern about excessive public debt.
predicted_en: Fortunately for them, there is a way to combine France’s fundamental concern (inequality’s dangers) and Germany’s (excessive public debt) in a desperate effort to save the euro.
Analysis: The model translation is "Fortunately for them, there is a way to combine France's fundamental concern (inequality's dangers) and Germany's (excessive public debt) in a desperate effort to save the euro." The phrase "desperate effort to save the euro" is added content that is not in the source and changes the tone from discussing policy principles to suggesting crisis management. The use of parentheses "(inequality's dangers)" and "(excessive public debt)" creates awkward, telegraphic phrasing. The phrase "a compelling way" is more natural than "a way," and the reference structure clearly distinguishes French concerns "about the dangers of inequality" from German concerns "about excessive public debt" without the awkward parenthetical shorthand. The correct translation should be "Fortunately for them, there is a compelling way to combine the fundamentally French concern about the dangers of inequality with the fundamentally German concern about excessive public debt."

source_zh: 在弗里德曼这一观点的信徒看来，一个经理人如果摒弃了股东利益最大化而是为其他目标奔忙的话，那就是离经叛道之举。
target_en: For the true believers in this creed, the suggestion that the manager of a business should strive for anything except maximizing value for shareholders is heresy.
predicted_en: According to Friedman’s disciples, a manager who abandons the goal of maximizing shareholder value in favor of other objectives is derelict in his duties as a steward of the corporation’s resources.
Analysis: The model translation is "According to Friedman's disciples, a manager who abandons the goal of maximizing shareholder value in favor of other objectives is derelict in his duties as a steward of the corporation's resources." The phrase "For the true believers in this creed" is more apt than "According to Friedman's disciples" because it captures the quasi-religious fervor. The word "derelict" meaning negligent is weaker than "heresy," which in the reference conveys that this view is treated as a betrayal of fundamental doctrine. The model adds "as a steward of the corporation's resources," which is not in the source and changes the focus from ideological betrayal to administrative failure. The correct translation should be "For the true believers in this creed, the suggestion that the manager of a business should strive for anything except maximizing value for shareholders is heresy."

source_zh: 难怪另一位环境主义者麦克吉本说 ： “ 我们人类正在毫无顾及地淹没地球的大部分地区以及其他生物 。 ”
target_en: Little wonder that fellow environmentalist Bill McKibben states that “we are engaging in a reckless drive-by drowning of much of the rest of the planet and much of the rest of creation.”
predicted_en: It is no wonder that another environmentalist, David Attenborough, has said, “Humanity is plundering the planet on an unprecedented scale, and other living things are paying the price.”
Analysis: The model translation is "It is no wonder that another environmentalist, David Attenborough, has said, 'Humanity is plundering the planet on an unprecedented scale, and other living things are paying the price.'" The model incorrectly identifies the speaker as "David Attenborough" when the source clearly refers to "McKibben" (麦克吉本), which is Bill McKibben. This is a complete misattribution of the quote to a different environmentalist. The quoted text is also completely different from the actual McKibben quote about "reckless drive-by drowning," suggesting the model may have substituted a different Attenborough quote entirely. The correct translation should be "Little wonder that fellow environmentalist Bill McKibben states that 'we are engaging in a reckless drive-by drowning of much of the rest of the planet and much of the rest of creation.'"

source_zh: 综艺节目是法国特色，堪与面包、奶酪和葡萄酒相提并论，但这并没有加强这位支持率已然低得离谱的总统的尊严和信誉。
target_en: Vaudeville may be a French specialty, like bread, cheese, and wine, but it does not strengthen the dignity and credibility of an already spectacularly unpopular presidency.
predicted_en: Reality shows are a French specialty, on a par with bread, cheese, and wine, but they do not enhance the dignity and credibility of a president whose approval ratings are already in the basement.
Analysis: The model translation is "Reality shows are a French specialty, on a par with bread, cheese, and wine, but they do not enhance the dignity and credibility of a president whose approval ratings are already in the basement." The word "Vaudeville" is mistranslated as "Reality shows," which are completely different entertainment forms – vaudeville refers to variety entertainment shows while reality shows are unscripted television. The phrase "堪与...相提并论" is correctly translated as "on a par with" in the model, but the reference uses "like" which is simpler. The phrase "already in the basement" is colloquial slang for low approval ratings, whereas the reference's "already spectacularly unpopular" is more formal and direct. The correct translation should be "Vaudeville may be a French specialty, like bread, cheese, and wine, but it does not strengthen the dignity and credibility of an already spectacularly unpopular presidency."

source_zh: 如果说谁投什么票是清楚的，那公众就会越来越多地要求讨论委员会的人选：既然货币政策委员会是事实上的货币当局，它为什么不能由选举产生呢？
target_en: If it is clear who will vote for which measure, there will be increased demand for a public debate about who should be chosen: why not elect the MPC, since it is effectively a monetary government?
predicted_en: If it is clear who votes, the public will increasingly demand that the ECB’s governors be elected: if the Governing Council is the de facto monetary authority, why should it not be elected?
Analysis: The model translation is "If it is clear who votes, the public will increasingly demand that the ECB's governors be elected: if the Governing Council is the de facto monetary authority, why should it not be elected?" The phrase "who votes" is grammatically incomplete and unclear compared to "who will vote for which measure," which specifies both the voter and what they vote on. The model changes "MPC" (Monetary Policy Committee) to "ECB's governors" and "Governing Council," which introduces different institutional references not in the source. The logic is also confused because the model treats "who votes" as about public visibility when the reference is about voting patterns on specific measures becoming predictable. The correct translation should be "If it is clear who will vote for which measure, there will be increased demand for a public debate about who should be chosen: why not elect the MPC, since it is effectively a monetary government?"

source_zh: 想象一下这个场景：一辆汽车正向一堵墙撞过去，车上的乘客就是消费者和投资者，这个时候，要让乘客安心，司机非得踩刹车不可。
target_en: Consider the following image: consumers and investors as passengers in a car hurtling directly toward a brick wall. In this case, the driver stepping on the brake will give the passengers more confidence.
predicted_en: Imagine a scenario in which a car is barreling toward a wall, with consumers and investors as its passengers, and the driver has no choice but to slam on the brakes. The passengers will not be reassured.
Analysis: The model translation is "Imagine a scenario in which a car is barreling toward a wall, with consumers and investors as its passengers, and the driver has no choice but to slam on the brakes. The passengers will not be reassured." The model adds "has no choice but" which contradicts the point being made. The original argues that the driver stepping on the brake WILL give passengers confidence, but the model says passengers "will not be reassured," which completely reverses the meaning. The model also splits this into two sentences, disrupting the logical flow. The phrase "In this case" in the reference clearly signals the consequence, but the model's structure obscures this connection. The correct translation should be "Consider the following image: consumers and investors as passengers in a car hurtling directly toward a brick wall. In this case, the driver stepping on the brake will give the passengers more confidence."

source_zh: 我和英国克雅氏病调查局的同事们认为，这种新形式的人类朊病毒疾病很可能与感染牛海绵状脑病因子或食用感染致病因子的肉制品有关。
target_en: My colleagues and I in NCJDSU argued that this new form of human prion disease was likely to be linked to exposure to the BSE agent, probably by eating BSE-infected meat products.
predicted_en: My colleagues and I at the United Kingdom’s Health Protection Agency believe that this new form of human prion disease is most likely related to infection with the agent of bovine spongiform encephalopathy (BSE), or “mad cow disease,” or with meat products infected with the infectious agent.
Analysis: The model translation is "My colleagues and I at the United Kingdom's Health Protection Agency believe that this new form of human prion disease is most likely related to infection with the agent of bovine spongiform encephalopathy (BSE), or 'mad cow disease,' or with meat products infected with the infectious agent." The institution name is wrong: the reference says "NCJDSU" (UK CJD Surveillance Unit) but the model says "United Kingdom's Health Protection Agency," which is a different organization. The verb "argued" is changed to "believe," which softens the scientific stance. The phrase becomes repetitive with "infectious agent" appearing twice and "or" used awkwardly multiple times. The word "probably" is changed to "most likely," which is a minor shift in hedging language. The correct translation should be "My colleagues and I in NCJDSU argued that this new form of human prion disease was likely to be linked to exposure to the BSE agent, probably by eating BSE-infected meat products."

source_zh: 首先，关注的焦点不应该是疾病普遍性的下降，而是疾病负担 — — 用致残和致过早死亡的标准来衡量 — — 的下降。
target_en: First, the primary concern should not be with reducing disease prevalence, but rather disease burden – the health impact as measured by disability and premature mortality.
predicted_en: For starters, the focus should not be on the decline in prevalence of diseases, but on declines in disease burden – measured by disability-adjusted life years (DALYs) lost to disability and premature death.
Analysis: The model translation is "For starters, the focus should not be on the decline in prevalence of diseases, but on declines in disease burden – measured by disability-adjusted life years (DALYs) lost to disability and premature death." The phrase "For starters" is too casual compared to the more formal "First" in the reference. The model adds the technical term "disability-adjusted life years (DALYs)" which is not in the source and adds unnecessary jargon. The reference's simpler phrase "the health impact as measured by disability and premature mortality" is clearer for a general audience. The model also creates awkward repetition with "decline... declines" and the redundant phrase "lost to disability and premature death" when disability is already part of the definition. The correct translation should be "First, the primary concern should not be with reducing disease prevalence, but rather disease burden – the health impact as measured by disability and premature mortality."

source_zh: 如果说有什么证据证明印度有必要实行总统制，那就是政府首脑每隔几个月就必须放弃职务责任为所在党派站脚助威的奇观。
target_en: If there ever were need for yet another clinching argument for a presidential system in India, it is the spectacle of the head of government abandoning the responsibilities of that office every few months to go on the stump for their party.
predicted_en: If there is any evidence that India needs a president, it is the bizarre spectacle of the head of government resigning every few months to campaign on behalf of his or her party.
Analysis: The model translation is "If there is any evidence that India needs a president, it is the bizarre spectacle of the head of government resigning every few months to campaign on behalf of his or her party." The phrase "resigning every few months" dramatically misrepresents what is happening. The reference says "abandoning the responsibilities of that office," which means neglecting duties temporarily, not actually resigning from the position. The word "bizarre" is added and is more judgmental than "spectacle" alone. The phrase "on behalf of his or her party" is wordier than "for their party." The model also loses "yet another clinching argument," which emphasizes this is one of many reasons, not the only evidence. The correct translation should be "If there ever were need for yet another clinching argument for a presidential system in India, it is the spectacle of the head of government abandoning the responsibilities of that office every few months to go on the stump for their party."

source_zh: 回避这一问题可能是为避免讨论这是否是一种变相大赦的谈判战术而已。 而不幸的是，在某种程度上这的确是一种变相的大赦。
target_en: The latter status may or may not include a path to residency and citizenship; fudging the issue may be a negotiating tactic to avoid debate over whether this is a form of disguised amnesty (which, fortunately, to a certain extent, it is).
predicted_en: Avoiding the issue may be an effort to avoid discussing whether it is a negotiating tactic that amounts to a de facto amnesty. Unfortunately, it is, to some extent, just that.
Analysis: The model translation is "Avoiding the issue may be an effort to avoid discussing whether it is a negotiating tactic that amounts to a de facto amnesty. Unfortunately, it is, to some extent, just that." The model creates confusing circular logic by saying "avoiding the issue may be an effort to avoid discussing" which is redundant. The reference structure is clearer: fudging the issue is to avoid debate about whether something is disguised amnesty. The model's phrase "whether it is a negotiating tactic that amounts to" garbles the logic – the question is not whether avoiding discussion is a tactic, but whether the policy itself is amnesty. The phrase "fortunately" in the reference indicates the author's positive view of amnesty, but this subtlety is lost. The correct translation should be "The latter status may or may not include a path to residency and citizenship; fudging the issue may be a negotiating tactic to avoid debate over whether this is a form of disguised amnesty (which, fortunately, to a certain extent, it is)."

source_zh: 在20世纪90年代末，贸易平衡强化不会带来产出增长或就业创造 — — 它们已经达到了马力全开的成都。
target_en: A stronger trade balance in the late 1990s would not have added to output growth or job creation, which were running at full throttle.
predicted_en: In the late 1990’s, trade balance strengthening did not lead to output growth or job creation – they were already at full throttle in Chengdu.
Analysis: The model translation is "In the late 1990's, trade balance strengthening did not lead to output growth or job creation – they were already at full throttle in Chengdu." The model makes a bizarre geographical error by adding "in Chengdu," suggesting the economy of one Chinese city when the reference clearly discusses the overall economy. The phrase "A stronger trade balance... would not have added to" uses conditional mood to indicate a hypothetical scenario, but the model's "did not lead to" treats it as actual history. The model also reverses the logic: the reference says strengthening the trade balance wouldn't help because the economy was already at capacity, not that strengthening happened but didn't help. The correct translation should be "A stronger trade balance in the late 1990s would not have added to output growth or job creation, which were running at full throttle."

source_zh: 至于已经实际执行的死刑 — — 四年中总共执行了两起 — — 按照客观标准确定相关犯罪比那些没有执行死刑的犯罪更加“罕见”或令人发指几乎没有可能。
target_en: As for the death sentences that have already been carried out – two in that four-year period – it is impossible to ascertain the objective criteria that made the crimes in question more heinous or “rarer” than those that did not merit execution.
predicted_en: As for the two executions actually carried out in the last four years – a period in which no executions were carried out at all – they are no more “rare” or “shocking” than the crimes that were not punished by death.
Analysis: The model translation is "As for the two executions actually carried out in the last four years – a period in which no executions were carried out at all – they are no more 'rare' or 'shocking' than the crimes that were not punished by death." The model creates a logical contradiction by saying executions were carried out in a period when no executions were carried out. The phrase "two in that four-year period" in the reference is clearer and avoids this confusion. The model also removes the important point about "objective criteria" making it impossible to determine why these crimes merited execution over others. The model's phrasing "no more rare or shocking than" reverses the meaning, suggesting all crimes are equally rare/shocking. The correct translation should be "As for the death sentences that have already been carried out – two in that four-year period – it is impossible to ascertain the objective criteria that made the crimes in question more heinous or 'rarer' than those that did not merit execution."

source_zh: 而奇怪的是，从国民党分裂出来的亲民党候选人宋楚瑜的优异表现帮助了马英九，因为前者提供了一个马英九之外的第二选项（因此那些不喜欢马英九的选民也不一定非要投给蔡英文 ） 。
target_en: Paradoxically, the strong performance of James Soong Chu-yu of the People First Party, which split from the Kuomintang, helped Ma by giving voters a second alternative to him.
predicted_en: And, paradoxically, the strong performance of the KMT’s pro-democracy candidate, Ma Ying-jeou, helped Tsai, because he provided an alternative to Ma (so that voters who disliked Ma did not necessarily have to vote for Tsai).

source_zh: 对于萨科奇的重返北约的决定，除了那些经常存在的左右派系思维和那套经典的法式论调（民族主义，种族主义和大西洋主义）之外，我们或许还能看到某种可以被恰当地形容为这位总统的“三重赌注”的东西。

source_zh: 协议失败往往不是因为写进协议的内容，而是因为没有写入的部分，或者因为签字方明明签字同意却违反自己的承诺。

source_zh: 如今我们明白某些市场霸主其实都像《皇帝的新衣》中那样一丝不挂，而他们的行为也极为危险，足以导致极大的金融动荡并给纳税人带来极大损失，更别说突如其来的全球性衰退了。

source_zh: 但是，与允许个人向全世界提供家具（furniture）不同，众筹是为了快速筹集资金，出资者都是内行，而筹资项目未必为银行家所理解。
target_en: But, unlike allowing individuals to offer their furniture to the whole world, crowdfunding is supposed to raise money fast, from those in the know, for businesses that bankers might not understand.
predicted_en: But, unlike allowing individuals to offer furniture to the world, crowdfunding is about raising money quickly, with contributors all inside the tent, and projects that are not necessarily banker-friendly.
Analysis: The model translation is "But, unlike allowing individuals to offer furniture to the world, crowdfunding is about raising money quickly, with contributors all inside the tent, and projects that are not necessarily banker-friendly." The model misses the key point of the comparison. The original contrasts offering "furniture" (a physical product) to the world with crowdfunding, but the model's version doesn't capture why this contrast matters. The phrase "contributors all inside the tent" is confusing and doesn't clearly convey "those in the know" (meaning knowledgeable insiders). The phrase "not necessarily banker-friendly" fails to capture "businesses that bankers might not understand," which emphasizes the bankers' lack of comprehension rather than the projects being unfriendly. The correct translation should be "But, unlike allowing individuals to offer their furniture to the whole world, crowdfunding is supposed to raise money fast, from those in the know, for businesses that bankers might not understand."

source_zh: 以色列人和巴勒斯坦人正在打一场低级别的战争；伊拉克的局势正在改善，但谁也不能做任何保证；奥巴马可能要在攻击伊朗核设施和容忍能在几周内制造出核武器的伊朗这两者之间作出选择；阿富汗政府正在失去与死灰复燃的塔利班斗争的优势；拥有几十枚核武器的巴基斯坦，是世界上最危险的恐怖分子的基地，巴基斯坦可能会成为一个失败的国家，而拥有核武器的北韩情况也一样。
target_en: Obama may have to choose between attacking Iran’s nuclear installations and living with an Iran that has the capacity to build a nuclear weapon in a matter of weeks. Afghanistan’s government is losing ground in its struggle against a revived Taliban.
predicted_en: Israelis and Palestinians are fighting a low-level war; the situation in Iraq is improving, but no one can be sure; Obama will have to choose between attacking Iran’s nuclear facilities and tolerating a nuclear Iran in a few weeks; and Afghanistan’s government is losing the fight with the resurgent Taliban.
Analysis: The model translation is "Israelis and Palestinians are fighting a low-level war; the situation in Iraq is improving, but no one can be sure; Obama will have to choose between attacking Iran's nuclear facilities and tolerating a nuclear Iran in a few weeks; and Afghanistan's government is losing the fight with the resurgent Taliban." This translation is severely incomplete, missing the entire second half of the original sentence about Pakistan and North Korea. The original discusses Pakistan being a potential failed state with nuclear weapons and a base for terrorists, and also mentions North Korea. The model completely omits these critical points about two nuclear-armed countries. Additionally, the phrase "tolerating a nuclear Iran in a few weeks" misinterprets the timeframe - the original says Iran could build weapons "in a matter of weeks," not that Obama must tolerate it "in a few weeks." The correct translation should be "Obama may have to choose between attacking Iran's nuclear installations and living with an Iran that has the capacity to build a nuclear weapon in a matter of weeks. Afghanistan's government is losing ground in its struggle against a revived Taliban."

source_zh: 霍尔姆斯在知道爱迪生系列设备没有效果后的很长时间内还一直在吹嘘她公司的透明度，并陶醉于它所得到天价估值。 她不仅是打破了黄金法则；她彻底熔化了公众的信任。
target_en: Holmes, who was touting her company’s transparency and reveling in its massive valuation long after she knew that the Edison machines were not cutting it, did not just break the Golden Rule; she melted it down.
predicted_en: Holmes continued to tout her company’s transparency, even after she knew that its devices were ineffective, and she basked in its sky-high valuation. She didn’t just break the golden rule; she melted down public trust.
Analysis: The model translation is "Holmes continued to tout her company's transparency, even after she knew that its devices were ineffective, and she basked in its sky-high valuation. She didn't just break the golden rule; she melted down public trust." The phrase "melted down public trust" is awkward and doesn't match the original's more impactful metaphor of "melted it down" where "it" refers to the Golden Rule itself. The model changes "Edison machines were not cutting it" (an idiomatic expression meaning not performing adequately) to "devices were ineffective," which is more clinical and loses the colloquial tone. The phrase "continued to tout" also misses the temporal emphasis in "was touting...long after." The correct translation should be "Holmes, who was touting her company's transparency and reveling in its massive valuation long after she knew that the Edison machines were not cutting it, did not just break the Golden Rule; she melted it down."

source_zh: 对于那些批评者来说，亚太经合组织只是一个空谈茶馆，而东盟则是中日两国正面交锋，印度则从旁暗中使劲的竞技场。
target_en: To cynics, APEC is a talking shop, while ASEAN is an arena for an ongoing contest between China and Japan, with India on the side.
predicted_en: For its critics, the ASEAN is just a talking shop, while the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) is the arena for a face-off between China and Japan, with India pulling the strings from the sidelines.
Analysis: The model translation is "For its critics, the ASEAN is just a talking shop, while the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) is the arena for a face-off between China and Japan, with India pulling the strings from the sidelines." This translation contains a confusing redundancy where "ASEAN" is mentioned twice, first as an acronym and then spelled out with the same acronym. The original text clearly refers to APEC as the "talking shop" and ASEAN as the competitive arena. The model completely confuses these two organizations. Additionally, "pulling the strings from the sidelines" doesn't accurately capture "on the side," which simply means India is involved but positioned to the side, not that it's secretly controlling things. The correct translation should be "To cynics, APEC is a talking shop, while ASEAN is an arena for an ongoing contest between China and Japan, with India on the side."

source_zh: 纽约—大约25年前，哈佛教授、当时担任美国住联合国大使和纽约州参议员的丹尼尔·帕德里克·莫伊尼汉（Daniel Patrick Moynihan）创造了“正常行为的堕落 ” （ Defining Deviancy Down）一词。
target_en: NEW YORK – Some 25 years ago, Daniel Patrick Moynihan, a Harvard professor who in the course of his career served as United States ambassador to the United Nations and a US senator from New York, coined the phrase “Defining Deviancy Down.”
predicted_en: NEW YORK – About 25 years ago, the Harvard professor and then-US Ambassador to the United Nations and New York State Senator Daniel Patrick Moyihan coined the phrase “defining deviancy down.”
Analysis: The model translation is "NEW YORK – About 25 years ago, the Harvard professor and then-US Ambassador to the United Nations and New York State Senator Daniel Patrick Moyihan coined the phrase 'defining deviancy down.'" The model misspells the name as "Moyihan" instead of "Moynihan," which is a clear named entity error. The phrase structure "the Harvard professor and then-US Ambassador" is also awkward because it makes it sound like he was all these things simultaneously in that order, when the reference more clearly separates his identity as a Harvard professor from his various roles "in the course of his career." The correct translation should be "NEW YORK – Some 25 years ago, Daniel Patrick Moynihan, a Harvard professor who in the course of his career served as United States ambassador to the United Nations and a US senator from New York, coined the phrase 'Defining Deviancy Down.'"

source_zh: 两国政府的运作方式非常相似：政党老板、富豪和分赃的腐败份子，宣扬“传统价值观 ” （ 无论是东正教还是儒学） 和沙文主义。
target_en: The way both governments operate is quite similar: party bosses, tycoons, and corrupt bureaucrats divide the spoils, while promoting chauvinism and “traditional values” – whether those of the Orthodox Church or Confucianism.
predicted_en: Both governments are run by party bosses, wealthy oligarchs, and corrupt cronies who preach “traditional values” (either Orthodox Christianity or Confucianism) and xenophobic nationalism.
Analysis: The model translation is "Both governments are run by party bosses, wealthy oligarchs, and corrupt cronies who preach 'traditional values' (either Orthodox Christianity or Confucianism) and xenophobic nationalism." The model adds "xenophobic nationalism" which wasn't in the original text about chauvinism. While related concepts, xenophobia and chauvinism are different - chauvinism is excessive patriotism, while xenophobia is fear of foreigners. The model also changes "divide the spoils" to "are run by," which loses the specific imagery of corrupt distribution of resources. The phrase "wealthy oligarchs" is redundant since oligarchs are by definition wealthy. The correct translation should be "The way both governments operate is quite similar: party bosses, tycoons, and corrupt bureaucrats divide the spoils, while promoting chauvinism and 'traditional values' – whether those of the Orthodox Church or Confucianism."

source_zh: 适用于老年人的肺炎球菌疫苗主要有两种 — — 23价肺炎球菌多糖疫苗（PPV23）和肺炎球菌结合疫苗（PCV13 ） — —都可以控制肺炎球菌传染病。
target_en: Two main types of pneumococcal vaccine available for older adults – the 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (PPV23) and the pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV13) – could ameliorate the situation.
predicted_en: Pneumococcal vaccines for the elderly come in two forms – PPV-23 and PCV-13 – both of which have been shown to control pneumococccal infections.
Analysis: The model translation is "Pneumococcal vaccines for the elderly come in two forms – PPV-23 and PCV-13 – both of which have been shown to control pneumococccal infections." The model uses "control pneumococcal infections" which is less precise than "ameliorate the situation" in capturing the broader impact of these vaccines. The original discusses how the vaccines "could ameliorate the situation," suggesting improvement of the overall problem, not just control of infections. The model also changes "Two main types...available for older adults" to "come in two forms," which is less formal and specific. Additionally, there's a typo "pneumococccal" with three c's. The correct translation should be "Two main types of pneumococcal vaccine available for older adults – the 23-valent pneumococcal polysaccharide vaccine (PPV23) and the pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV13) – could ameliorate the situation."

source_zh: 如果改革成行，埃尔多安获得的权力甚至将超过备受尊敬的现代土耳其“之父”穆斯塔法·凯末尔·阿塔图尔克（Mustafa KemalAtatürk ） 。
target_en: If the reform passes, Erdoğan will acquire powers exceeding even those held by Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, the venerated “father” of modern Turkey.
predicted_en: If the reforms are enacted, Erdoğan will have more power than even the much-respected modern Turkish “father,” Mustafa Кemal Atatюрk.
Analysis: The model translation is "If the reforms are enacted, Erdoğan will have more power than even the much-respected modern Turkish 'father,' Mustafa Кemal Atatюрk." The model has encoding errors in the name "Atatürk," rendering it as "Кemal Atatюрk" with what appears to be Cyrillic characters mixed in. The model also changes "If the reform passes" (singular) to "If the reforms are enacted" (plural), which slightly changes the meaning. Additionally, "much-respected" doesn't capture the reverence implied by "venerated," and the model adds quotes around "father" which weren't in the original, potentially suggesting skepticism about the title. The correct translation should be "If the reform passes, Erdoğan will acquire powers exceeding even those held by Mustafa Kemal Atatürk, the venerated 'father' of modern Turkey."

source_zh: 任何没有意识到即将到来的“大火”的人，只要听一听美联储主席耶伦最近在国会山所受到的诘难便可略知一二。
target_en: Anyone unaware of the incoming fire only had to listen to the grilling Fed Chair Janet Yellen received recently on Capitol Hill.
predicted_en: Anyone who was not aware of the impending “big bang” could get a sense of it by listening to the grilling that Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan recently received on Capitol Hill.
Analysis: The model translation is "Anyone who was not aware of the impending 'big bang' could get a sense of it by listening to the grilling that Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan recently received on Capitol Hill." The model incorrectly identifies the Fed Chair as "Alan Greenspan" when the original clearly states it was "Janet Yellen." This is a significant factual error as these are two different people who served in different time periods. The model also changes "incoming fire" to "impending 'big bang'" with unnecessary quotation marks, which alters the metaphor. The phrase "Anyone who was not aware" is more wordy than "Anyone unaware." The correct translation should be "Anyone unaware of the incoming fire only had to listen to the grilling Fed Chair Janet Yellen received recently on Capitol Hill."

source_zh: 这一方针虽好，但忽略了一个当务之急：确保实际上能够创造足够多的新岗位。 没有新岗位，培训得再好的工人还是没有工作。
target_en: This is all well and good, but one imperative is missing: ensuring that enough new jobs actually are created.
predicted_en: While this approach makes sense, it overlooks the urgent need to ensure that enough new jobs are actually being created to absorb the better-trained workers. Without new jobs, training workers better is not enough.
Analysis: The model translation is "While this approach makes sense, it overlooks the urgent need to ensure that enough new jobs are actually being created to absorb the better-trained workers. Without new jobs, training workers better is not enough." The model adds an entire extra sentence "Without new jobs, training workers better is not enough" that wasn't in the original. While this addition captures the implied meaning, it changes the structure and adds content beyond what was stated. The model also changes "one imperative is missing" to "it overlooks the urgent need," which is more interpretive than the original's straightforward statement. The phrase "to absorb the better-trained workers" also adds explanation not present in the original. The correct translation should be "This is all well and good, but one imperative is missing: ensuring that enough new jobs actually are created."

source_zh: 从根本上说，即使他们和白芝浩观点一致，也没有银行家不认为市场信心要求他们拿出更坚实的资本基础来吸引批发融资和满足监管者更严厉的要求。
target_en: Even if, at heart, they take the Bagehot view, all bankers recognize that market confidence requires them to demonstrate a more solid capital base to attract wholesale funding, as well as to satisfy the stricter demands of regulators.
predicted_en: Fundamentally, even if they agree with Blankfein, no banker believes that market confidence requires them to have a stronger capital base to attract wholesale funding and meet tougher regulatory requirements.
Analysis: The model translation is "Fundamentally, even if they agree with Blankfein, no banker believes that market confidence requires them to have a stronger capital base to attract wholesale funding and meet tougher regulatory requirements." The model changes "take the Bagehot view" to "agree with Blankfein," completely substituting one person/concept for another. Bagehot refers to Walter Bagehot, a 19th-century economist, while Blankfein refers to Lloyd Blankfein, a modern banker - these are entirely different references. The model also reverses the logic by saying "no banker believes that market confidence requires" when the original states "all bankers recognize that market confidence requires," which is the opposite meaning. The correct translation should be "Even if, at heart, they take the Bagehot view, all bankers recognize that market confidence requires them to demonstrate a more solid capital base to attract wholesale funding, as well as to satisfy the stricter demands of regulators."

source_zh: 美联储主席珍妮特·耶伦（Janet Yellen）在用来描述政策正常化的时间路径的“相当长时间”的定义上纠缠不清，实际上也在滑向同样的陷阱。
target_en: By splitting hairs over the meaning of the words “considerable time” in describing the expected timeline for policy normalization, Fed Chair Janet Yellen is falling into the same trap.
predicted_en: Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellin’s definition of “quite some time” to describe the time path for policy normalization is ambiguous, and she, too, is sliding into the same trap.
Analysis: The model translation is "Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellin's definition of 'quite some time' to describe the time path for policy normalization is ambiguous, and she, too, is sliding into the same trap." The model misspells "Yellen" as "Yellin," which is a minor error. More importantly, the model changes the focus from "splitting hairs over the meaning of the words 'considerable time'" to just defining "quite some time." The original emphasizes the excessive attention to word choice ("splitting hairs"), while the model only mentions the definition being "ambiguous." The phrase "she, too, is sliding" uses present tense when the reference uses present progressive "is falling," and the "too" suggests comparison that isn't as clear in context. The correct translation should be "By splitting hairs over the meaning of the words 'considerable time' in describing the expected timeline for policy normalization, Fed Chair Janet Yellen is falling into the same trap."

source_zh: 为买入危险性资产而需要的额外5000亿美元的出现将减少危险资产的数量，这些是私有投资人所必须持有的。
target_en: The appearance of an extra $500 billion in demand for risky assets will reduce the quantity of risky assets that other private investors will have to hold.
predicted_en: The appearance of an additional trillion dollars for buying risky assets, which private investors must hold, would reduce the number of riskyassets that private investORS must hold.
Analysis: The model translation is "The appearance of an additional trillion dollars for buying risky assets, which private investors must hold, would reduce the number of riskyassets that private investORS must hold." The model changes "$500 billion" to "an additional trillion dollars," which is a factual error doubling the amount. The phrase "which private investors must hold" creates confusion about whether this refers to the trillion dollars or the risky assets. The model also has a typo "riskyassets" (no space) and "investORS" (inconsistent capitalization). The fundamental logic is also confused - the original explains that extra demand reduces what other investors must hold, but the model's phrasing makes this circular by saying money that investors must hold reduces assets that investors must hold. The correct translation should be "The appearance of an extra $500 billion in demand for risky assets will reduce the quantity of risky assets that other private investors will have to hold."

source_zh: “绿色经济”一词提出已经很多年了 — — 甚至要早于1992年首届地球峰会 — — 本意是为了提供考察经济和可持续性之间联系的新视角。 但在气候变化已成现实、商品价格节节攀升、清洁空气、可耕土地和清洁水源日渐稀缺的世界中，绿色经济一词被赋予了新的含义。
target_en: But it has gained a new impetus in a world where climate change is already a reality, commodity prices are rising, and basic resources such as clean air, arable land, and fresh water are increasingly scarce.
predicted_en: The term “green economy” was coined many years ago – even before the first Earth Summit in 1982 – to provide a new perspective on the link between economics and sustainability. But in a world of soaring commodity prices, scarce clean air, arable land, and clean water, the term has taken on a new meaning.
Analysis: The model translation is "The term 'green economy' was coined many years ago – even before the first Earth Summit in 1982 – to provide a new perspective on the link between economics and sustainability. But in a world of soaring commodity prices, scarce clean air, arable land, and clean water, the term has taken on a new meaning." The model changes "1992" to "1982," which is a factual error - the first Earth Summit was in 1992, not 1982. The model also removes the important context about climate change being "already a reality" and changes "commodity prices are rising" to "soaring commodity prices," which is more dramatic. More significantly, the model completely reorganizes the text, moving the "new meaning" explanation to a separate paragraph when it should be part of the continuing thought. The correct translation should be "But it has gained a new impetus in a world where climate change is already a reality, commodity prices are rising, and basic resources such as clean air, arable land, and fresh water are increasingly scarce."

source_zh: 该决议只能影响美国制裁，而不能让协议作废，事实证明，其他所有国际力量取消制裁便足以促使伊朗不再讨价还价。
target_en: Given that the resolution would affect only US sanctions, it might not nullify the agreement, with the lifting of sanctions by all other international powers proving sufficient motivation for Iran to uphold its end of the bargain.
predicted_en: The fact that the resolution only affects US sanctions, and does not invalidate the deal, demonstrates that all other international powers lifting sanctions would be enough to persuade Iran to forgo bargaining for bargains.
Analysis: The model translation is "The fact that the resolution only affects US sanctions, and does not invalidate the deal, demonstrates that all other international powers lifting sanctions would be enough to persuade Iran to forgo bargaining for bargains." The phrase "forgo bargaining for bargains" is awkward and unclear. The original says "uphold its end of the bargain," meaning to fulfill its obligations, not to stop bargaining. The model fundamentally misunderstands the meaning. The model also changes "Given that" to "The fact that," which shifts from a conditional to a declarative statement. Additionally, "might not nullify" becomes "does not invalidate," which changes from possibility to certainty. The correct translation should be "Given that the resolution would affect only US sanctions, it might not nullify the agreement, with the lifting of sanctions by all other international powers proving sufficient motivation for Iran to uphold its end of the bargain."

source_zh: 他的年龄（68岁）可能成为他在2017年大选中的一大障碍，但也有可能成为优势：他是四人中唯一一位让人放心的政治家式的人物。 其他三人中一个是令人失望的现任，另两人急不可耐并且眼里只有全力。
target_en: His age (he is 68) might prove to be a handicap in 2017, but it could also be an advantage: he is the only reassuring statesman-like figure in a quartet whose other members are an uninspiring incumbent and two power-obsessed men in a hurry.
predicted_en: His age (he is 68) could be a liability in the 20₁7 election, but it could also be an asset: he is the only one of the four who comes across as a reassuring statesman, while the other three are disappointing incumbents or impatient and desperate.
Analysis: The model translation is "His age (he is 68) could be a liability in the 20₁7 election, but it could also be an asset: he is the only one of the four who comes across as a reassuring statesman, while the other three are disappointing incumbents or impatient and desperate." The model changes "power-obsessed men in a hurry" to "impatient and desperate," which loses the specific characterization of being obsessed with power. The phrase "comes across as" is more colloquial than "reassuring statesman-like figure." The model also makes it sound like all three others are either disappointing incumbents OR impatient people, when the original specifies "an uninspiring incumbent and two power-obsessed men in a hurry" - distinguishing between one incumbent and two others. The subscript formatting in "20₁7" appears to be an encoding issue. The correct translation should be "His age (he is 68) might prove to be a handicap in 2017, but it could also be an advantage: he is the only reassuring statesman-like figure in a quartet whose other members are an uninspiring incumbent and two power-obsessed men in a hurry."

source_zh: 在2003年到2004年年间，可能是国际货币基金组织不得不为其成员国提供有价值的帮助的最后阶段，提供的金融援助数额的约80%建立在“例外”基础上，超过配额的300 % 。
target_en: In 2003-2004, arguably the last period in which the Fund had to provide meaningful assistance to members, approximately 80% of the volume of financial support was provided on an “exceptional” basis, defined as more than 300% of quotas.
predicted_en: Between 2103 and 2014, the IMF’s lending to its members was based on “exceptional access” to about 80%, and in excess of the quota-based ceiling of 30% of the total amount of financial assistance provided.
Analysis: The model translation is "Between 2103 and 2014, the IMF's lending to its members was based on 'exceptional access' to about 80%, and in excess of the quota-based ceiling of 30% of the total amount of financial assistance provided." The model has a critical typo changing "2003" to "2103," which makes the timeframe nonsensical - putting it a century in the future. The phrase "based on 'exceptional access' to about 80%" is grammatically confused and doesn't clearly convey that 80% of the volume was provided on an exceptional basis. The model also changes "300% of quotas" to "30% of the total amount," which is a different measure entirely. The sentence structure is also unclear about what the 80% refers to. The correct translation should be "In 2003-2004, arguably the last period in which the Fund had to provide meaningful assistance to members, approximately 80% of the volume of financial support was provided on an 'exceptional' basis, defined as more than 300% of quotas."

source_zh: 但联盟同时也从前任政府手中接手了一个烂摊子，全球经济危机严重冲击了该国经济，但由于不负责任的选举操作，前任政府不但没有尝试去克服困难，还许下众多收买民心的空头支票，巨额的政府预算赤字已经占到GDP的16 % 。
target_en: The global economic crisis not only hit the country hard, but, because of irresponsible electioneering, the previous government did not even try to fight it. Reckless populist promises left a gaping 16%-of-GDP budget deficit.
predicted_en: But the coalition has also inherited a mess, with the global economic crisis hitting the economy hard, and the previous government not only failing to try to overcome the difficulties, but also resorting to many empty promises to buy popularity. The government’s budget deficit is already 16% of GDP.
Analysis: The model translation is "But the coalition has also inherited a mess, with the global economic crisis hitting the economy hard, and the previous government not only failing to try to overcome the difficulties, but also resorting to many empty promises to buy popularity. The government's budget deficit is already 16% of GDP." The model omits the crucial context that the crisis "not only hit the country hard, but, because of irresponsible electioneering, the previous government did not even try to fight it." The model changes this to a weaker "failing to try to overcome the difficulties" which doesn't capture the deliberate choice not to fight the crisis. The model also adds "resorting to many empty promises to buy popularity" when the original more specifically says "Reckless populist promises left a gaping 16%-of-GDP budget deficit." The model's version separates the deficit into its own sentence, losing the causal connection to the populist promises. The correct translation should be "The global economic crisis not only hit the country hard, but, because of irresponsible electioneering, the previous government did not even try to fight it. Reckless populist promises left a gaping 16%-of-GDP budget deficit."

source_zh: 事实上，当我们考虑由于人类行为引起的气候变化的可能后果时，如果我们对此作出错误的决定，那么，南非由于姆贝基错误政策所造成的死亡人数和这个错误决定所造成的死亡人数相比，会相形见绌。
target_en: Indeed, when we contemplate the possible consequences of climate change caused by human activities, the number of human lives that could be lost by the wrong decision dwarfs the number lost in South Africa.
predicted_en: Indeed, when we consider the possible consequences of human-induced climate change, if we make the wrong decisions, South Africa’s death toll from Mbeki’s misguided policies will be dwarfed by the number of deaths caused by the wrong decision itself.
Analysis: The model translation is "Indeed, when we consider the possible consequences of human-induced climate change, if we make the wrong decisions, South Africa's death toll from Mbeki's misguided policies will be dwarfed by the number of deaths caused by the wrong decision itself." The model creates circular and confusing logic by saying "wrong decisions" will lead to deaths that dwarf deaths from "the wrong decision itself" - this makes it sound like the same thing. The original makes a clearer comparison: if we make the wrong decision about climate change, those deaths would dwarf the deaths in South Africa from Mbeki's AIDS policies.
